physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 24, there was mild spastic left hemiparesis, brisk reflexes except for absent ankle jerks, both toes up-going on plantar stimulation. No rigidity, bradykinesia, or tremor was noted. Sensation was normal. At age 26, the patient had severe bilateral ptosis, prominent gaze-evoked nystagmus, and some extraocular motor paresis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 24, mild spastic left hemiparesis was observed and evolved into severe bilateral ptosis and nystagmus by age 26. There was no improvement in ptosis with edrophonium. Initial normal visual acuity and optic fundi were maintained with no optic nerve abnormalities.
